question.body: Which direction does the descending limb of the nephron loop travel?

response.feedback: Incorrect. In humans, posterior means towards the back.
Incorrect. Dorsal means towards the back.
Incorrect. Inferior means below. There is no reference point to indicate what it would be moving inferiorly to.

Correct. The term descending refers to the movement of the segment of the nephron loop away from the renal cortex into the renal medulla. If the glomerulus and proximal convoluted tubule areis in the renal cortex at the ‘top’ of the nephron, then the descending limb of the nephron loop appears to descend or move away from the proximal tubule.
